title: Drawing, "A Room in a Florentine Palace", 1824
medium: Brush and watercolor, gouache, gold paint, graphite on white wove paper
inscribed: On the old mount: Cabinet de ma mere a Florence, 1824
provenance:
Eugene V. Thaw Collection

Ex. Coll.: Artemis Fine Arts, Ltd., London
dimensions:
Frame H x W x D: 39.7 x 50.2 x 2.5 cm (15 5/8 x 19 3/4 x 1 in.)
Sheet: 17.8 x 27.9 cm (7 x 11 in.)
description: The wall decoration in the eighteenth century grisaille technique is obscured by mirrors and a portrait. The Louis XVI ormolu-mounted table, bergere armchair and upholstered wood-framed seating furniture constitute a room of mixed style. A table covered by a blue cloth for writing or painting stands near the window. A small boy in a white dress and pantalettes stands in front of the door.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "A Room in a Florentine Palace", 1824.
1824. Brush and watercolor, gouache, gold paint, graphite on white wove paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-7.
